presentation_review.title: Automated Detection of Tow-Gap Defects in Cross-Ply Composites

suggestions.current_content: Research shows significant decreases in compressive & tensile strength.
suggestions.suggestion: Quantify 'significant'. Example: 'Research indicates a 15-20% drop in compressive strength.' This makes the problem urgent rather than just theoretical.

suggestions.current_content: Images divided into 512×512 patches to balance context and detail.
suggestions.suggestion: Include a visual diagram showing a full AFP ply alongside the extracted 512x512 patches. This visualizes the 'context vs. detail' trade-off for the audience.

suggestions.current_content: Fast enough for near real‑time AFP inspection.
suggestions.suggestion: Replace 'Fast enough' with specific metrics, such as 'Inference time: 22ms per patch (45 FPS),' to prove it matches production speeds.
Briefly address the 3% error rate. Are these false positives (halting production unnecessarily) or false negatives (missing defects)? A confusion matrix would add significant technical depth here.
Add a final slide covering 'Deployment & Future Work'. Explain how this pipeline integrates into the factory floor software (e.g., ROS nodes, PLC integration).
